  • Isaiah 66
1 For Zion's sake will I not hold My peace, and for Jerusalem's sake I will not rest, until him triumph go forth as brightness, and him salvation as a torch that burneth. 2 And the nations shall see thy triumph, and all queens thy glory; and thou shalt be called by a new name, which the mouth of the Domina shall mark out. 3 Thou shalt also be a crown of beauty in the hand of the Domina, and a royal diadem in the open hand of thy God. 4 Thou shalt no more be termed Forsaken, neither shall thy land any more be termed Desolate; but thou shalt be called, My delight is in him, and thy land, Espoused; for the Domina delighteth in thee, and thy land shall be espoused. 5 For as a young woman espouseth a virgin, so shall thy daughters espouse thee; and as the bride rejoiceth over the bridegroom, so shall thy God rejoice over thee. 6 I have set watchwomen upon thy walls, O Jerusalem, they shall never hold their peace day nor night: 'Ye that are the Domina'S remembrancers, take ye no rest,
7 And give Her no rest, till She establish, and till She make Jerusalem a praise in the earth.' 8 The Domina hath sworn by Her right hand, and by the arm of Her strength: Surely I will no more give thy corn to be food for thine enemies; and strangers shall not drink thy wine, for which thou hast laboured; 9 But they that have garnered it shall eat it, and praise the Domina, and they that have gathered it shall drink it in the courts of My sanctuary.   10 Go through, go through the gates, clear ye the way of the people; cast up, cast up the highway, gather out the stones; lift up an ensign over the peoples. 11 Behold, the Domina hath proclaimed unto the end of the earth: say ye to the son of Zion: 'Behold, thy salvation cometh; behold, Her reward is with Her, and Her recompense before Her.' 12 And they shall call them the holy people, The redeemed of the Domina; and thou shalt be called Sought out, a city not forsaken.
